channel.title: Username upon log-in?
channel.description:
I would like to add a system where if a username is above 12 letters it would ban the user straight away, if anyone has any idea how i could do this please post.
Thanks :)

item.title: Username upon log-in?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“Lewis), post:9, topic:324269”][quote author=The Soul link=topic=420670.msg3089974#msg3089974 date=1262820165]

So where is the “run() method declaration” i’m not quite sure.

public void run() {

[/quote]

I get a error -

.\client.java:220: cannot find symbol symbol : variable size location: class java.lang.String String[] name = new String[playerName.size]; ^ .\client.java:221: cannot find symbol symbol : method toArray(java.lang.String[]) location: class java.lang.String playerName.toArray(name); ^ .\client.java:223: operator > cannot be applied to java.lang.String,int if(name[i] > 12 || name[i] < 2) { ^ .\client.java:223: operator < cannot be applied to java.lang.String,int if(name[i] > 12 || name[i] < 2) { ^ 4 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

Switch size with length().

Read full topic

[/quote]

I get a error -

item.title: Username upon log-in?
item.dc:creator: @Lewis3 Lewis)
item.description:
@Lewis3 wrote:

This is the top of my run method

[code] public void run() {
// we just accepted a new connection - handle the login stuff
isActive = false;
long serverSessionKey = 0, clientSessionKey = 0;

	// randomize server part of the session key
	serverSessionKey = ((long) (java.lang.Math.random() * 99999999D) << 32)
			+ (long) (java.lang.Math.random() * 99999999D);[/code]

I would add name(); just after public void run() {? so then it will be like

public void run() { name(); // we just accepted a new connection - handle the login stuff isActive = false; long serverSessionKey = 0, clientSessionKey = 0;

Read full topic

item.title: Username upon log-in?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“Lewis), post:3, topic:324269”][quote author=The Soul link=topic=420670.msg3089948#msg3089948 date=1262818701]

public void name() { String[] name = new String[playerName.size]; playerName.toArray(name); for(int i = 0; i < name.length; i++) { if(name[i] > 12 || name[i] < 2) { return; } } }
then add this to the run() method in the client class:

name();

This will just reject the connection.
[/quote]

Thanks alot :), where abouts does the name(); go?[/quote]

It’s an invokation, so put it directly under the run() method declaration.

Read full topic

item.title: Username upon log-in?
item.dc:creator: @Lewis3 Lewis)
item.description:
@Lewis3 wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:2, topic:324269”]public void name() { String[] name = new String[playerName.size]; playerName.toArray(name); for(int i = 0; i < name.length; i++) { if(name[i] > 12 || name[i] < 2) { return; } } }
then add this to the run() method in the client class:

name();

This will just reject the connection.[/quote]

Thanks alot :), where abouts does the name(); go?

item.title: Username upon log-in?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

public void name() { String[] name = new String[playerName.length()]; playerName.toArray(name); for(int i = 0; i < name.length; i++) { if(name[i] > 12 || name[i] < 2) { return; } } }
then add this to the run() method in the client class:

name();

This will just reject the connection.

Read full topic
